attributes.action: Sack Cleveland police officers responsible for shoting abandoned dog.
attributes.background:
On the 21st of January 2018 an elderly German shepherd was tied to a lamppost and abandoned, the police were unable to find the owner.

Rather then sedate the dog then monitor and assess its behaviour in a kennel as is normal procedure they shot it and in front of children.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions that ask to sack people. If you're concerned about a particular police decision, you can contact your local police force. 

You can find your local police force here:

https://www.police.uk/

You could also contact your local police and crime commissioner. You can find out more about how to do that here: 

http://www.cleveland.pcc.police.uk/Home.aspx

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
